I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. Nothing like a traumatic stress from an unreal title to your movie and repulsive promotional image to have pretence over your parody on misogynistic attitudes. If any, the film flips hate prong of the masculinity vs femininity gender skirmish in our generation.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat prowling the neighborhood. One of the most awful felines since Palace Petula, has just targeted an innocent, female victim who runs one of those terrible bookstores. It is a story of guilt and revenge - acted out entirely by animals.
This is a low-budget slasher film with two scrawny actors
